meanings.definition: To surpass in speed, achievement, or performance.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah outstripped the other animals in the race.
meanings.sent2: The athlete outstripped his previous record in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident he could outstrip his speedy competitor.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed outstripped any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The rocket outstripped all expectations, reaching incredible speeds.

meanings.definition: To leave behind in a race or competition.
meanings.sent1: The hare outstripped the tortoise in the race.
meanings.sent2: The car outstripped the other vehicles on the track.
meanings.sent3: The snail jokingly challenged the rabbit to a race, knowing it could never outstrip its speedy friend.
meanings.sent4: His passion for running outstripped his fear of losing.
meanings.sent5: The wind outstripped the sails, propelling the boat forward at an incredible speed.
